page.title: 10Barkby houses.
page.content:
Another reminder of the past is a blacksmith's forge that is still working and one or two houses the still have thatched roofs.
Most of the houses are farmworkers' cottages and were built of brick in the nineteenth century. The different brick colours were used to create patterns which make the houses look very nice. They have slate roofs and some have specially shaped chimney stacks calld "Queen" chimneys. Most of the houses are joined together to form 'terraces' and have no front gardens but the front door has steps leading straight onto the pavement.
Many of the walls around the village are made of granite from the local quarries at Mountsorrel.
